result.execSummary:
Carlos OVIEDO-OLGUIN was extradited to another county, state or jurisdiction. Extradition means Carlos OVIEDO-OLGUIN was accused or convicted of an offense in another county, state or jurisdiction and was taken there to face their charge(s) or conviction.

Notice to employers: It may be a violation of state law to discriminate against a job applicant because of an arrest or conviction record. Generally speaking, an employer may refuse to hire an applicant on the basis of a conviction only if the circumstances of the conviction substantially relate to the particular job. For more information, see Wisconsin Statute 111.335 and the Department of Workforce Development's publication, Arrest and Conviction Records under the Law.
result.caption: State of Wisconsin vs. Carlos OVIEDO-OLGUIN

records.descr: Records of prosec. are converted data. See file.

records.addlTxt:
Order Revoking Bail.
Copy to jail.

Defendant in custody.
John Vaughn, appears to interpret for the defendant.
The State has obtained the necessary paperwork from the State of Wisconsin and the State of Texas.
EXHIBIT 1, governors warrant and attached paperwork, marked, offered and received.
The defendant will allow authorities from the State of Texas to come and get him.
The Court questions the defendant and the defendant does not contest the extradition to the State of Texas.  The Court finds that he has freely, voluntarily and intelligently waived his rights and finds grounds to extradite the defendant and order that he be extradited to Texas.
The State moves to revoke bail.  Motion granted.  State to prepare the order.
Interperter voucher.
Minutes.
Order Denying Defendant's Motion to Modify Bond.

MOTION TO MODIFY BAIL - 
Defendant in custody.
John Vaughn is sworn to interpret.
The parties argue the motion.
The Court comments and denies the otion.
State to draft the order.
John confirms that he is scheduled for the next hearing on 06-09-14.
Interpreter voucher.
Minutes.
Notice of Motion and Motion to Modify Bond.
Motion hearing is set for 05-29-14 at 9:30 a.m.

Defendant in custody.
John Vaughn is sworn to interpret.
The Court took a waiver of extradition on this defendant on Monday.  Since then, the court has become aware that the defendant's name is spelled wrong.  His correct name is Carlos Oviedo-Olguin.
At this time, the defendant no longer wishes to waive his extradition to Texas.  He no longer waives his right to a hearing and asks for an extradition hearing to be set.
Extradition hearing is set for 06-09-14 at 8:30 a.m.
Court sets bail at $50,000.00 cash with the conditions that he is to report twice per day, at 8:00 a.m. and 5:00 p.m. to the Manitowoc County Jail.  Bail not furnished and the defendant is remanded into custody.  Commitment for failure to furnish bail issued. Copy filed.
Interpreter voucher.
Minutes.

Defendant in custody.
John Vaughn, is sworn to interpret for the defendant.
The defendant is explained his rights and waives his right to an extradition hearing.
Defense counsel states that the defendant's name is not correct on the waiver form.  The Court instructs defense counsel to add the A/K/A on the waiver form.
The Court finds that grounds exist for extradition to the State of Texas.
The defendant signs the waiver of extradition; the Court signs the waiver of extradition.
Copies distributed.
Waiver of Extradition.
Interpreter voucher.
Minutes.
